article.headline: Boston College 72, Seton Hall 63
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Craig Smith scored 26 points and Jared Dudley added 18 points as Boston College overcame an 11-point second-half deficit for a 72-63 victory over Seton Hall on Saturday. BC (12-4, 2-2 Big East) snapped a two game losing streak while Seton Hall lost its second consecutive game after winning seven in a row. Seton Hall (11-4, 1-2) cut the deficit to three on Andre Sweet's 3-pointer with 4:25 left, but Boston College center Nate Doornekamp hit just his second 3-pointer of the season to make it 58-52. Seton Hall's John Allen hit two free throws to make it 61-58 with less than two minutes left, but Dudley converted a layup and Sean Marshall hit one of two free throws to extend the lead to 64-58. The teams traded baskets before J.R. Morris' 3-pointer cut it to 66-63. Dudley then hit five foul shots in the final 26 seconds to seal the win. Andre Barrett led Seton Hall with 19 points and Allen added 15 points and eight rebounds. Boston College went on a 8-0 run midway through the first half to take a 20-17 lead, but Seton Hall closed out the half with seven straight points, including a long 3-pointer from Barrett, to take a 33-26 halftime lead. The Eagles took a 43-42 lead on Marshall's 3-pointer with 12:58 remaining. Boston College played without point guard Louis Hinnant, who sat out with an ankle injury.
